intro: Lampranthus macrostigma, commonly known as the red-hot poker or fireplant, is a member of the Aizoaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has fleshy, succulent leaves that help it store water, adapting it to arid environments. It produces showy, bright orange or red flowers that attract pollinators like bees and birds. Lampranthus macrostigma is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
